protocol_name: Quantification of circulating microRNA using droplet digital PCR
protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using droplet digital PCR
description:
A protocol for quantification of circulating microRNA using droplet digital PCR with TaqMan assays.

MicroRNAs are purified from platelet-poor plasma using Nucleospin columns

During the purification step samples are spiked with cel-miR-39 as a mean of technical normalization

Normalization are performed by calculating the relative concentration of the target microRNA and the reference.
before_start:
We recommend to use a few samples to test if the volume of spike-in added during microRNA purification is adequate before purifing all your samples.

The concentration of the spike-in and the target miRNA should be within the same range, otherwise adjust the volume of spike-in added during miRNA purification.

guidelines:
Blood samples should be obtained using a minimum of venous stasis and with discard of the first 3 mL of blood.

Platelet-poor plasma should be prepared within 2 hours from blood sampling
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Preparation of platelet-poor plasma (PPP)
components.name: Section

components.data:
Dual centrifugation

  1. use 10 ml of EDTA anticoagulated whole blood
  2. centrifugation at 3000 g for 15 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)
  3. transfer plasma phase to new tube, leaving approximately 1 mL of plasma on top of the buffy coat
  4. centrifugation at 3000 g for 15 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)
  5. transfer plasma phase to cryo tubes, leaving approximately 1 ml of plasma in the bottom of the tube
  6. store at -80 °C
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of Quantification of circulating microRNA
source_data.protocol_name: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.annotation:
Alternatively, a prolonged single centrifugation may be used

1. use 5 ml of EDTA anticoagulated whole blood

2. centrifuge at 3000 g for 30 minutes (acceleration 5, brake 6, temperature 18 °C)

3. transfer plasma phase to cryo-tubes, leaving approximately 0.5 ml of plasma on top of the buffy coat
source_data.thread_text:

source_data.protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA)
source_data.annotation:
STEP 1: use 300 µL platelet-poor plasma

STEP 4: after addition of isopropanol, add also 5 µL spike-in (cel-miR-39, 2.75 × 10−12 M)

STEP 6: perform the optional DNA digest

components.data: Reverse transcription
components.name: Section

source_data.reagent_vendor_name: Applied Biosystems, Foster City, California, USA

components.data: Reverse transcription
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare RT master mix:

 

Component

Master mix volume per

15 µL reaction*
100 mM dNTPs (with dTTP) 0.15 µL
Multiscribe RT enzyme (50 U/µL) 1 µL
10x RT buffer 1.5 µL
RNase inhibitor (20 U/µL) 0.19 µL
Nuclease free water to 15 µL in total**

*add 10-20% excess volume

**add water to a total reaction volume of 15 µL (including microRNA and RT-primers, see step 7)

 

Mix gently and place on ice
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Component

Mix gently and place on ice

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 5 of Quantification of circulating microRNA using droplet digital PCR
source_data.protocol_name: Quantification of circulating microRNA using droplet digital PCR
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quantification of circulating microRNA using droplet digital PCR
source_data.annotation:
Remember to include a RT-negative sample (no template)

It is also a good idea to include a RT-positive sample (a microRNA-sample included in all runs)
source_data.thread_text:
Remember to include a RT-negative sample (no template)

It is also a good idea to include a RT-positive sample (a microRNA-sample included in all runs)
source_data.body:
Remember to include a RT-negative sample (no template)

It is also a good idea to include a RT-positive sample (a microRNA-sample included in all runs)

components.data:
For each RT reaction, combine RT master mix with 2 µL of purified microRNA in a 0.2 µL polypropylene reaction tube

(the volume of RT master mix is dependent on the number of RT-primers, see step 7)

Keep on ice
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each RT reaction, combine RT master mix with 2 µL of purified microRNA in a 0.2 µL polypropylene reaction tube

(the volume of RT master mix is dependent on the number of RT-primers, see step 7)

Keep on ice

components.data:
Prepare RT primer mix:

Add for each RT reaction 0.75 µL 20x RT primer from each microRNA assay set

 

Example with two microRNA assays:

Component Volume per 15 µL reaction*
20x RT specific primer #1 0.75 µL
20x RT specific primer #2 0.75 µL
Total volume 1.5 µL**

 *add 10-20% excess volume

**when using two microRNA assays the volume of water needed in step 5 is 8.66 µL for each reaction, and the volume of master mix added in step 6 is 11.5 µL

 

Mix gently
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Example with two microRNA assays:

Total volume 1.5 µL**

**when using two microRNA assays the volume of water needed in step 5 is 8.66 µL for each reaction, and the volume of master mix added in step 6 is 11.5 µL

 

Mix gently

components.data:
Add the appropiate volume of RT primer mix to the reaction tubes prepared in step 6

Mix gently and incubate on ice for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add the appropiate volume of RT primer mix to the reaction tubes prepared in step 6

Mix gently and incubate on ice for 5 minutes

components.data:
Transfer the reaction tubes to a termocycler

Incubate at 16 °C for 30 min, at 42 °C for 30 min and at 85 °C for 5 min.
components.name: Description

components.data: Droplet digital PCR
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare ddPCR reaction mix:

 

Component Volume per 20.3 µL reaction*
2x ddPCR supermix 24 µL
20x TaqMan microRNA assay 2.4 µL
Nuclease free water 19 µL
Total volume 45.4 µL

*add 10-20% excess volume

 

Mix gently
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare ddPCR reaction mix:

 

Component Volume per 20.3 µL reaction*
2x ddPCR supermix 24 µL
20x TaqMan microRNA assay 2.4 µL
Nuclease free water 19 µL
Total volume 45.4 µL

*add 10-20% excess volume

 

Mix gently

components.data:
1. Dilute each of the RT-reactions (cDNAs) 1:10 with nucleace free water (e.g. 2 µL cDNA + 18 µL water)
  2. Combine 45.4 µL of ddPCR reaction mix with 2.6 µL of diluted RT-reaction (cDNA) in a 96 well plate
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Dilute each of the RT-reactions (cDNAs) 1:10 with nucleace free water (e.g. 2 µL cDNA + 18 µL water)
  2. Combine 45.4 µL of ddPCR reaction mix with 2.6 µL of diluted RT-reaction (cDNA) in a 96 well plate

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data:
Transfer plate to termocycler

Incubate in 95 °C for 5 minutes

Proceed with 44 cycles of 95 °C for 15 sec and 60 °C for 60 sec.

Final incubation in 98 ºC for 10 min

Cool to 4 °C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer plate to termocycler

Incubate in 95 °C for 5 minutes

Proceed with 44 cycles of 95 °C for 15 sec and 60 °C for 60 sec.

Final incubation in 98 ºC for 10 min

components.data: Droplet generation

source_data.reagent_name: Automated Droplet Generation Oil for Probes

components.data: Droplet generation
components.name: Section

components.data:
1. Transfer 22 µL of the reaction mixture into each of two wells on an empty 96 well plate
  2. Heat sealing
  3. Transfer plate to the AutoDG
  4. The AutoDG transfers 20 µL from each well to a GD32 cartidge for droplet generation
  5. Heat sealing of output plate
